text: Correct place to put extra startup code in django?
I would like to run some environment checks when my django process starts and die noisily in the case of an error.
I'm thinking things like the database has an incorrect encoding or the machine has a python version we don't support.
I'd rather our team be faced with a fatal error that they have to fix, rather than be able to ignore it.
I'm Ok with writing these checks but  I'm curious about where the best place to put them is.
How do I get them to execute as part of django's startup process?
I thought there might be a signal I could listen too, but I can't find a relevant one in the docs.
